name: NewYorker
text: A remake of “Rebecca” could have been fertile terrain on which to explore issues of control, abuse, and the sheer terror of becoming a wife at all. The superficial new Netflix adaptation fails to plumb these possible depths. https://t.co/CdhzI3sLUf

name: NewYorker
text: With his delivery-only pop-up, Ribs n Reds, Bryce Shuman offers spareribs and fried chicken that are exquisitely rendered while retaining a familiar, unpretentious quality. https://t.co/nJTOhWO4AS

name: NewYorker
text: “The default condition of humankind, traced across thousands of years of history, is some sort of autocracy,” Adam Gopnik writes. “Keeping a republic is a matter not of preserving it like pickles but of working it like dough.” https://t.co/chgW6sbkwf

name: NewYorker
text: From Trump impressions to extinction comedy, the humor of 2020 managed to make light of a dark time. https://t.co/7v2EUX0Pbp

name: NewYorker
text: Daphne Caruana Galizia’s sons suspected that her murder had been arranged by someone who believed that, in Malta, it was less dangerous to assassinate a reporter than to let her complete her work.  https://t.co/PIG2rvTppv

text: Recordings from Bob Dylan, Run the Jewels, and other artists that served as a sonic life raft during a difficult year. https://t.co/XonvgWZa9E

text: Meet the man behind the M.T.A.’s subway voice-overs. https://t.co/oIlCWKKR6z

name: NewYorker
text: “I don’t know if I can possibly describe the pride,” Jenna Lyons said, of seeing Michelle Obama and her daughters in J. Crew at the Inauguration. “They represented a real turning point in our country and our belief system.” https://t.co/2Be1nWJbk1

name: NewYorker
text: 5G could pump twelve trillion dollars into the global economy by 2035. This 5G world, we are told, will usher in a fourth industrial revolution. https://t.co/6j9CGoBrJG

name: NewYorker
text: Stanley Kubrick and Arthur C. Clarke set out to make a new kind of sci-fi. How does their future look now that it’s the past? https://t.co/AO5TrqJtgB

name: NewYorker
text: A study conducted in the 1970s and 80s found that stuck writers are often unhappy—and that different kinds of unhappiness lead to different kinds of writer’s block. https://t.co/B4UVOjfbO7

name: NewYorker
text: A shortfall of clinicians is becoming an insurmountable barrier in the fight against COVID-19, @DhruvKhullar writes. https://t.co/wRvCRL6m75

name: NewYorker
text: Courts have rebuffed the attorney James Mermigis, but he keeps filing cases and winning new clients. “It’s crazy how I’m the only one really that’s doing this,” he said. https://t.co/plUVDdxtLU

name: NewYorker
text: In 2018, Dollar General’s C.E.O. received more than $10 million in total compensation, nearly 800 times the median pay for workers at the company. https://t.co/1VWm3kIkiT

text: .@xwaldie selects 10 worthwhile books published in this Very Weird Year. https://t.co/iwCwkalbIn

name: NewYorker
text: How did the fight over vaccines became so similar to the fight over every political issue in America? https://t.co/v0MLX5clR4

name: NewYorker
text: There is no set-it-and-forget-it solution to democratic fragility, Adam Gopnik writes. “The only way to stave oﬀ another Trump is to recognize that it always happens.” https://t.co/OEWQlxSRB2

name: NewYorker
text: “There are three moments in the yearlong catastrophe of the COVID-19 pandemic when events might have turned out differently,” @lawrence_wright writes, in a deeply reported examination of how, exactly, we ended up where we are today. https://t.co/x7G0fvYulI

name: NewYorker
text:
“This checked a lot of boxes for my dream next thing,” Anthony Weiner said, of the countertop-manufacturing company he’s been running since May.
https://t.co/TgXGdNo8cl

name: NewYorker
text: In theory, the approval of two vaccines for the coronavirus should have made reaching a deal on a new spending deal easier. The barrier is raw partisan politics on the part of the G.O.P., @JohnCassidy writes. https://t.co/MHNYG8mzLC

name: NewYorker
text: In a new report spanning nearly the entirety of this week’s issue, Lawrence Wright looks back at the yearlong catastrophe of the COVID-19 pandemic, and at the fatal missteps—and heroic efforts—that defined the U.S.’s response. https://t.co/NCcG4cW04u

name: NewYorker
text: “In getting rid of New Year’s Eve for 2020-21, I suggest we take the opportunity to get rid of it altogether,” Sarah Miller writes. https://t.co/1zI8IAraSJ

text:

name: NewYorker
text: Robert Redfield, the director of the C.D.C., speaks with George Fu Gao, his counterpart in China, about an unexplained respiratory virus emerging in Wuhan. Gao assures Redfield that there is no evidence of human-to-human transmission. https://t.co/NCcG4cW04u https://t.co/eqkG3FunV9

name: NewYorker
text: The first COVID-19 case is identified in America. At the World Economic Forum, in Davos, President Trump is dismissive of the threat, saying, “it’s one person coming in from China. It’s going to be just fine.” https://t.co/NCcG4cW04u https://t.co/UyEUFiOREM

name: NewYorker
text: Less than a week after authorizing the C.D.C’s diagnostic test, the F.D.A. learns that 10 labs working with C.D.C. test kits are reporting failures. The Trump Administration insists on continuing with the kits. https://t.co/NCcG4cW04u https://t.co/TWtt2rgOK4

name: NewYorker
text: January 3rd: Robert Redfield, the director of the C.D.C., speaks with George Fu Gao, his counterpart in China, about an unexplained respiratory virus emerging in Wuhan. Gao assures Redfield that there is no evidence of human-to-human transmission. https://t.co/NCcG4cW04u https://t.co/Wpb18XeQgU

name: NewYorker
text: January 20th: The first COVID-19 case is identified in America. At the World Economic Forum, in Davos, President Trump is dismissive of the threat, saying, “it’s one person coming in from China. It’s going to be just fine.” https://t.co/NCcG4cW04u https://t.co/Ku2olD1nVT

name: NewYorker
text: March 16th: The first human vaccine trial begins. President Trump issues national guidelines for closing schools and restaurants, and limiting travel—and tells governors, “respirators, ventilators, all the equipment—try getting it yourselves.” https://t.co/NCcG4cW04u https://t.co/X78ntN0nsw

name: NewYorker
text:

name: NewYorker
